news.title: Golden Stars Shines Again on the Global Stage
news.author: Admin
news.excerpt: Ololade Naomi Olayinka of Golden Stars High School has been honoured with the British Council Outstanding Cambridge Learners Award for emerging Top in the World in English as a Second Language...
news.content:
In another remarkable display of academic excellence, Golden Stars Schools has once again brought international acclaim to Nigeria. Ololade Naomi Olayinka, a student of Golden Stars High School Ikeja, has been honoured with the prestigious British Council Outstanding Cambridge Learners Award for emerging Top in the World in English as a Second Language (Speaking Endorsement) at the 2024 Cambridge IGCSE examinations.

This outstanding achievement is a testament to the school's commitment to nurturing global citizens equipped with world-class communication skills. Ololade's success adds to the growing list of Golden Stars students who have distinguished themselves on the international stage.

Speaking at the award ceremony, the Managing Director, Mrs. Grace Adeyemi, expressed immense pride in Ololade's achievement. 'This is what we strive for every day - helping our students reach their full potential and compete confidently on any platform worldwide.'

Ololade, in her acceptance speech, dedicated the award to her teachers, parents, and the entire Golden Stars family for their unwavering support and guidance throughout her academic journey.

news.title: Golden Stars Alumnus Bags First Class Honours in Neuroscience
news.author: Admin
news.excerpt: Nnemdi Emmanuella Osadunkwu, a shining example of what it means to live the Golden Stars legacy, has graduated with First Class Honours in Neuroscience from the University of Alberta, Canada...
news.content:
The Golden Stars legacy of excellence continues to shine through its alumni. Nnemdi Emmanuella Osadunkwu, a former student of Golden Stars High School, has distinguished herself by graduating with First Class Honours in Neuroscience from the prestigious University of Alberta, Canada.

Emmanuella's journey at Golden Stars laid a solid foundation for her academic success. 'The discipline, critical thinking skills, and love for learning that Golden Stars instilled in me have been my guiding principles throughout my university education,' she shared.

Her research in neuroplasticity has already garnered attention in academic circles, with several publications to her name. She plans to pursue a Ph.D. and continue contributing to the field of neuroscience.

The Golden Stars Alumni Association has celebrated her achievement, highlighting it as an inspiration to current students that the Golden Stars education truly prepares students for global success.

news.title: Golden Stars Student Emerges Best 2024 WAEC Candidate in Lagos
news.author: Admin
news.excerpt: Mbaraonye Ncheta Evans of Golden Stars High School VGC has won the Sidmach Prize for emerging as the best 2024 WAEC candidate in Lagos State...
news.content:
In yet another testament to academic excellence, Mbaraonye Ncheta Evans, a student of Golden Stars High School VGC, has emerged as the best candidate in the 2024 West African Senior School Certificate Examination (WASSCE) in Lagos State.

The prestigious Sidmach Prize was awarded to Ncheta for his outstanding performance, achieving A1 grades in all nine subjects he sat for, including the notoriously challenging Further Mathematics and Chemistry.

Ncheta, who aspires to study Electrical Engineering at MIT, attributes his success to the dedicated teachers at Golden Stars and the conducive learning environment. 'My teachers went above and beyond - they were always available for extra lessons and clarification, even on weekends,' he said.

The award ceremony, held at the Lagos State Ministry of Education, was attended by the Commissioner of Education, who commended Golden Stars Schools for their consistent delivery of excellent results year after year.

news.title: Golden Stars Launches New STEM Innovation Center
news.author: Admin
news.excerpt: Golden Stars Schools has officially launched its state-of-the-art STEM Innovation Center, equipped with robotics labs, 3D printers, and cutting-edge technology to prepare students for the future...
news.content:
Golden Stars Schools has taken another bold step towards preparing students for the future with the official launch of its state-of-the-art STEM Innovation Center. The center, which was commissioned by the Minister of Education, represents a significant investment in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics education.

The facility boasts cutting-edge equipment including robotics labs with LEGO Mindstorms and VEX robotics kits, 3D printers, laser cutters, VR headsets for immersive learning experiences, and dedicated coding stations.

Speaking at the launch, the Managing Director emphasized the school's commitment to staying ahead of the curve. 'We believe that the future belongs to those who can create, innovate, and solve problems. This center will give our students the tools and skills they need to become tomorrow's leaders and innovators.'

The STEM Innovation Center is now open to all Golden Stars students from Year 4 upwards, with specialized programs and after-school clubs to maximize its impact.

news.title: Annual Parent-Teacher Conference Records Huge Success
news.author: Admin
news.excerpt: The 2024 Annual Parent-Teacher Conference brought together over 1,000 parents and guardians to discuss student progress and school development...
news.content:
The 2024 Annual Parent-Teacher Conference held at Golden Stars Schools was a resounding success, with over 1,000 parents and guardians in attendance - the highest turnout in the school's history.

The conference provided a platform for meaningful dialogue between parents and teachers about student academic progress, behavioral development, and future educational pathways. Breakout sessions covered topics including digital literacy, mental health awareness, and university preparation.

Key highlights included the presentation of the school's annual report, which showcased outstanding academic achievements across all campuses, and the unveiling of plans for the upcoming academic year, including new facilities and expanded programs.

Parents expressed appreciation for the transparent communication and the opportunity to engage directly with teachers. 'I left the conference feeling more connected to my child's education and confident in the school's commitment to excellence,' one parent shared.
